borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The bulk, mass, scale, siting and design of the combined approved extensions on top of the addition part rear extension would result in an overbearing and unneighbourly impact harmful to the standard of living for occupants at no.88b Saville Road. As such the proposal is contrary to:<br></div><div><span style="font-size:11pt">The National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021),&nbsp;Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local LDF Core Strategy (2010), policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide DPD (2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2012),&nbsp;and policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The LBBD Draft Local Plan (2021).</span><br></div>

<div>The bulk, mass, scale, siting and design of the proposed development is considered disproportionately sized, with excessive depth compared to the original dwellinghouse which is considered harmful to the character of the house and the built form of the uniform terrace row.&nbsp; As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;The National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local LDF Core Strategy (2010), policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide DPD (2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2012), and policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The LBBD Draft Local Plan (2021).<br></div><div><br></div>
description: Construction of a single storey side and rear extension with one roof light.
